segments.text: This kitchen feels so ordinary, yet something's off.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes, but the water is just pouring out of the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's standing in a puddle and doesn't even realize it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me feel sorry for her, so unaware of the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on that shaky stool is reaching for cookies, risking a fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He could get hurt any moment, and no one's watching.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so hopeful, hand outstretched, but this feels wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're breaking the rules in secret, which is kind of heartbreaking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The beautiful garden outside contrasts with this indoor chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would notice and stop the trouble before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water damage to the cabinets will be a real disappointment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene just leaves me with a sense of quiet sorrow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like innocence mixed with inevitable mishaps.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Poor things, caught in their own unaware bubble.
segments.speaker: PAR
